content:
the Observer is a studentrun daily print  online newspaper serving Notre Dame Saint Marys  Holy Cross PERIOD Learn about us PERIOD

Ryan Klaus  Monday November  

On a chilly Sunday afternoon Pasquerilla East proved to be too formidable an opponent for Walsh as the Pyros rolled to a  victory PERIOD

Pyros coach Kendall Moore knew this would not be an easy game for his team however he said he knew if his team played well they would have a good chance of winning PERIOD

We knew we were going to get tested today but we wanted to come out and start fast and execute Moore said PERIOD We knew that if we played our best we were going to be tough to beat PERIOD So we wanted to come out here and compete at the highest level. pyros quarterback Macy Mulhalls two touchdown passes and an impressive allaround defensive effort carried Pasquerilla Eastto victory PERIOD In the first quarter both teams traded touchdowns with Walsh scoring a long touchdown off a halfback pass PERIOD However Walsh could not complete its conversion and trailed  heading into the second quarter PERIOD

In the second quarter Mulhall took advantage of a Pyros interception by throwing a short touchdown pass giving the Pyros a  lead into the half PERIOD After a Pyros threeandout to start the second half Walsh was deep into the Pyros territory when the Pasquerilla Eastforced a momentumswinging interception in their end zone PERIOD Walsh was unable to recover and the Pyros scored two touchdowns in the fourth quarter to put the game away  PERIOD

Moore said he was satisfied with his teams performance PERIOD

Im really proud of the way we played today Moore said PERIOD It wasnt our best game and we still have some room for improvement so Im excited to see what the next two games hold for us PERIOD Hopefully we can get into the stadium to play for the championship and play well out there. share This Story
